quotes.t: In the mid-'60s, Toronto was home to Yorkville, a gathering spot for draft resisters, a petri dish for a {qword}nascent{/qword} coffeehouse and rock scene similar to the one developing in New York's Greenwich Village.
It was almost 80 years ago that the Wright brothers from Ohio ventured to Kitty Hawk for the uplift its steady winds offered their {qword}nascent{/qword} passion, airplanes.

A few centuries late, when the {qword}nascent{/qword} science of geology was gathering evidence for the earth's enormous antiquity, some advocates of biblical literalism revived this old argument for our entire planet.

et: Latin {it}nascent-, nascens{/it}, present participle of {it}nasci{/it} to be born {ma}{mat|nation|}{/ma}
shortdef: coming or having recently come into existence
